pullRequest.body: Define shifted Legendre polynomials and prove that it is integer polynomial. In the same time, its evaluation on x is equal to the evaluation on 1 - x.

nodes.body:
### PR summary [ca4befba64](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22620/commits/ca4befba6447596913b5441d3210e6ec0a535965)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.ShiftedLegendrePoly` (new file)|1586|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ shiftedLegendre`
`+ shiftedLegendre_eq_int_poly`
`+ shiftedLegendre_eq_sum`
`+ shiftedLegendre_eval_symm`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

May I ask you to use this as the (irreducible) definition of `shiftedLegendre`? Although mathematically it's `derivative^[n] (X ^ n * (1 - X) ^ n) / n !` but this definition does not make it definitionally over `Z`. In order to make it "an element" of `Z[X]` in Lean, it's best to use this sum as the definition. Marking it as `irreducible_def` makes it don't expand. Later you can state theorems such as `n ! * shiftedLegendre n = derivative^[n] (X ^ n * (1 - X) ^ n)` as "elements" of `Z[X]`, and `<lifting of shiftedLegendre n to K[X]> = (n ! : K)⁻¹ • derivative^[n] (X ^ n * (1 - X) ^ n)` for any characteristic zero field `K` which automatically includes `Q`, `ℝ` or `C`. Which also means that your file shouldn't mention `ℝ` nor importing any files on `ℝ`.

pullRequest.title: feat: Define shifted Legendre polynomials and prove some basic properties
